funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.utilities

Class RootSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • funkatronics.code.tactilewaves.dsp.utilities.RootSolver

  • public class RootSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to solve for the roots of polynomials using the Durand-Kerner root finding algorithm.

    The convergence criteria of the algorithm can be adjusted to trade accuracy for performance.

    See Also:
    LPC

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • roots

        public static Complex[] roots(double[] p,
                              boolean maximizeAccuracy)
                       throws SolverNotConvergedException
        Solve for the roots of a polynomial
        Parameters:
        p - the polynomial coefficients
        maximizeAccuracy - sets the accuracy level of the root solver. A value of true returns more accurate results with a larger computational cost.
        Returns:
        the complex roots of the polynomial in a Complex array
        Throws:
        SolverNotConvergedException - if the root solver could not converge to a solution

      • roots

        public static Complex[] roots(double[] p,
                              double stopThreshold,
                              int maxIterations)
                       throws SolverNotConvergedException
        Solve for the roots of a polynomial
        Parameters:
        p - the polynomial coefficients
        stopThreshold - the convergence threshold. When the roots change by less than this value between iterations, the algorithm stops and returns the roots. Smaller values lead to more accurate results with a larger computational cost.
        maxIterations - if the iteration surpasses this value before meeting the converge threshold, a SolverNotConvergedException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the complex roots of the polynomial in a Complex array
        Throws:
        SolverNotConvergedException - if the root solver could not converge to a solution
